intro: Salpingolobivia aurea, commonly known as the golden pipevine, is a striking plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, resembling small pipes, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the Aristolochiaceae family, known for its complex and often fragrant floral structures. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while the stems are woody and can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
